dsa.algorithms.search

Class LinearSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • dsa.algorithms.search.LinearSearch

  • public class LinearSearch
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains search methods which are implemented using Linear Search.

    The methods in this class all throw a NullPointerException, if the specified array reference is null, except where noted.

    It is used when the array has only a few elements, or when performing a single search in an un-ordered array.

    Time Complexity(Best) Time Complexity(Average) Time Complexity(Worst) Space Complexity
    Ω(1) θ(n/2) O(n) O(1)

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public static int search(char[] a,
                         char key)
        Searches the specified array for the specified value using the linear search algorithm. If the array contains multiple elements with the specified value, then first element is considered.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be searched
        key - the value to be searched for
        Returns:
        index of the search key, if it is contained in the array; otherwise, -1. Note that this guarantees that the return value will be >= 0 if and only if the key is found.

      • search

        public static int search(char[] a,
                         int fromIndex,
                         int toIndex,
                         char key)
        Searches a range of the specified array for the specified value using the linear search algorithm. If the array contains multiple elements with the specified value, then first element is considered.
        Parameters:
        a - the array to be searched
        fromIndex - the index of the first element (inclusive) to be searched
        toIndex - the index of the last element (exclusive) to be searched
        key - the value to be searched for
        Returns:
        index of the search key, if it is contained in the array; otherwise, -1. Note that this guarantees that the return value will be >= 0 if and only if the key is found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if(fromIndex > toIndex)
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if(fromIndex < 0 || toIndex > a.length)
